column5: Its on the road to Fort Frances ...the 502...yup right next to the road...Pritchard is less than 1 m before it on the same road....thats great info about the walleye, there is a little house by the lake there, never had the nerve to go ask the occupants if there are fish in it.   Thanks again for the info..guess i'll find out soon enough.
ADDED UPDATES....hope i aint borin anyone...cuz watching ice form could be like watching paint dry to some i guess.

Not boring to me Simon, just anxious to see fish porn coming from hard water in your neiborhood     Minus 10 in the good old Outaouais.... going to try for musky one last time tomorrow afternoon..... then it's hard water for sure Wish me luck!! Jacques
BEST OF LUCK JACQUES    go get 'em
Thanks Simon your a real trooper

Not boring to me either. Looking forward to Nipissing freezing up. At least it will get me out of the house on weekends to go out to the cottage and cut some wood. Then in January for a little wally fishing.
Very nice!  (that first picture is just great!)
Oh wow!!  To see that ice gets me sooo excited..  Please keep me posted on how thats goin..  I've been playing with my ice gear for the last three weeks and I'm only five hours away..

5 hours away???   I dont get it....it took me 21hrs to drive from here to St. Thomas....you know.......Dryden....Thunder Bay.....Wawa....Sault St. Marie....Saginaw....Flint....Sarnia.....and finally after a long time.....St. Thomas
Naw...I think if you hit Sarnia you've gone too far!  Oh wait....you're coming back up from MI...right....never mind      5 hours?!?!?!  Maybe iceslayer has a plane?
"oooooh bosss.....dee plane....dee plane!"
Great report, pics and vids limeyangler  Loved the scenery shots.... well done Thanks for sharing Leechman
Love those ice pics!!!   It's almost here!!!!!!  I am hyperventilating got to stop looking at them!!!
Great shots Limey!  Nice to have some unexpected company fly into visit.
thought i'd update the ice conditions here.
That's pretty cool, thanks for the update!!  Joey
Hey Simon, great news for you    but do me a favour, be extra carefull on that thin ice    if it cracks, it's not a good sign  Thanks for the update Will be keeping an eye out for your report Jacques
Cool idea  (pun intended)

Thanks Leechman, i will be careful. Its only 3 feet deep where i was standing.....i wont be trying any deeper waters untill at leas next Tuesday...although i might try a small pond around the corner thats been frozen over since the 10th on Friday/Saturday...all depends on whether i can get someone out there with me...you know...hold onto the rope tied to me from shore....lol.
Ooops!!  My bad.  Look'n at the wrong spot..lol  Probably wishfull think'n..

Some great pics limeyangler.  I was up your way in the summer on a business/fishing trip.  I actually stayed just outside of Sioux Lookout.  You have an amazing fishery up there.  So many lakes to chose from, I'm jealous.  Anyways, you were asking about Flambeau Lake and if there were any fish in there.  I was invited to go fishing out there by one of our customers but couldn't make it.  Apparently there is lots of nice walleye in there.  You can see it from right along the Trans Canada can't you, if it's the one I'm thinking of.  Also, Pritchard rings a bell too.  Good stuff
